oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ökologische Ziegenfleischproduktion – Möglichkeiten und Grenzen
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zenke, Sabine
Rahmann, Prof. Dr. Gerold
Hamm, Prof. Dr. Ulrich
Euen, Sven
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
Markets and trade
Farming Systems
Sheep and goats
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic goat meat production in milking herds is difficult because the production costs (milk) are higher than the price of the animal on the market. A survey done in 2008 was to find out the production potential and limits of goat meat with an organic marketing strategy. The results show that there is no fattening and marketing strategy on organic milking goat farms. Retailers can help to improve these production problems through fair prices on the contract level.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Zenke, Sabine; Rahmann, Prof. Dr. Gerold; Hamm, Prof. Dr. Ulrich and Euen, Sven (2009) Ökologische Ziegenfleischproduktion – Möglichkeiten und Grenzen. Poster at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
